sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's rule
message_1:
There are three equations with three variables:
2x + 3y + z = 14,
x - 2y + 3z = -1,
3x + y - z = 7.

Use Cramer's rule to find the values of x, y, and z.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using Cramer's rule, we first need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix (D), and then the determinants of the matrices obtained by replacing each column with the constants column (Dx, Dy, Dz).

The coefficient matrix is:
| 2  3  1 |
| 1 -2  3 |
| 3  1 -1 |

To find the determinant D, we use the formula:
D = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg)

Plugging in the values from the matrix:
D = 2((-2)(-1) - (3)(1)) - 3((1)(-1) - (3)(3)) + 1((1)(1) - (-2)(3))
D = 2(2 - 3) - 3(-1 - 9) + 1(1 + 6)
D = 2(-1) + 3(10) + 7
D = -2 + 30 + 7
D = 35

Now, we'll find Dx, Dy, and Dz by replacing the respective columns with the constants column (14, -1, 7).

Matrix for Dx:
| 14  3  1 |
| -1 -2  3 |
|  7  1 -1 |

Determinant Dx:
Dx = 14((-2)(-1) - (3)(1)) - 3((-1)(-1) - (3)(7)) + 1((-1)(1) - (-2)(7))
Dx = 14(2 - 3) - 3(1 - 21) + 1(-1 + 14)
Dx = 14(-1) + 3(20) + 13
Dx = -14 + 60 + 13
Dx = 59

Matrix for Dy:
| 2 14  1 |
| 1 -1  3 |
| 3  7 -1 |

Determinant Dy:
Dy = 2((-1)(-1) - (3)(7)) - 14((1)(-1) - (3)(3)) + 1((1)(7) - (-1)(3))
Dy = 2(1 - 21) - 14(-1 - 9) + 1(7 + 3)
Dy = 2(-20) + 14(10) + 10
Dy = -40 + 140 + 10
Dy = 110

Matrix for Dz:
| 2  3 14 |
| 1 -2 -1 |
| 3  1  7 |

Determinant Dz:
Dz = 2((-2)(7) - (-1)(1)) - 3((1)(7) - (-1)(3)) + 14((1)(1) - (-2)(3))
Dz = 2(-14 - 1) - 3(7 + 3) + 14(1 + 6)
Dz = 2(-15) - 3(10) + 14(7)
Dz = -30 - 30 + 98
Dz = 38

Now, we can find the values of x, y, and z using the determinants:

x = Dx / D = 59 / 35
y = Dy / D = 110 / 35
z = Dz / D = 38 / 35

The solution for the system of linear equations is:
x ≈ 1.6857
y ≈ 3.1429
z ≈ 1.0857
